nodes.text: Lando Calrissian: Idiot's Array is a short story written by Rich Handley, originally exclusive to Hyperspace. It is a sequel to two previous stories by Handley: Crimson Bounty, in Star Wars Adventure Journal 14, which featured the bounty hunter Thune, and "Lady Luck" in Star Wars Tales 3, which explained how Lando won Cloud City with help from Lobot. Idiot's Array brings back Thune, who has been hired to track down Lando and Lobot for their actions in Lady Luck. The story was originally slated to appear in Star Wars Gamer magazine, but never saw publication due to that magazines cancellation. Years later, it was finally published on Hyperspace. On October 1, 2012, it was republished on Suvudu, a subsidiary website of Random House publishing.

Lando Calrissian, having recently assumed the role of Baron Administrator on Cloud City, and his Chief Administrative Aide, the cyborg Lobot, avoid being captured by a bounty hunter, Thune, sent to collect on a contract put out on them by Dominic Raynor, the former owner of the Bespin mining colony.
